page.title: 01LAND SURVEY
page.content: Although the land survey suggests that the area is covered by large arable fields, there is quite a variety of land cover, some covering areas of significant size but occupying sections of more than one block. They include a large area of old pasture land, fields which are rotated from arable to grassland for sheep, several small areas of woodland and one large steep-sided valley which is quite uncultivated called Deepdale Firs. Set in the Lincolnshire Wolds, an area of hilly chalkland, it is a very undulating area with a high point of 117metres and a low point of 50metres, quite belying the common misconception that Lincolnshire is a flat county. When the fields are ploughed the various colours of chalk can be seen on the hillsides.
